pros: supportive work environment and employees were great

pros: NCU has many opportunities for students to work on campus.
cons: NCU is an extremely conservative proud evangelical school and workplace. This means that casual and overt racism, sexism, homophobia, xenophobia happens every day.

pros: Small, so you know most people

pros: Work with wonderful people and gain great experience.
cons: There are no cons to this job.

job_title: Head Lacrosse Coach in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Nice people and a positive culture at NCU. The pay was okay and they didn't expect a ton from you.
cons: There is a ton of turnover in the athletic department which makes it hard. There is not a winning culture there at all.

job_title: Director of Human Resources in Minneapolis, MN
pros: It is a caring and modestly paced environment. Although the work is never done, there is empathy and understanding.
cons: Higher education is very challenging. Many traditional methods and practices have needed to be re-thought and turning the corner is difficult. With many institutions offering on-line programs, those institutions still offering residential education models have a rough road ahead of them.

pros:
tons of support
great community life
opportunities for growth

job_title: Enrollment Processing Specialist in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Uplifting environment, friendly co-workers, weekends off
cons: Hours are not super flexible

pros: community is amazing and fun

pros: Fairly laid back. Lunch was inexpensive most days. Health insurance was pretty good actually. Lots of vacation time every year.
cons: Way too much distrust among departments. People would do that thing where they CC your boss before  talking to you directly first.

review_title: Positive with most co-workers. Many negative experiences with the VP's of the org. They are very disconnected.
job_title: Marketing Team Member in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Laid back, loads of time off and holidays.
cons: Lack of trust department to department and leadership is not connected with the reality of things inside the org.

pros: Staff gets $2.50 lunches at the caf a few days a week. That’s it.
cons:
I don’t have enough room to write everything out, but the most extravagant cons are highlighted by:

-tremendously low pay (I am unable to even afford simple livings expenses as a full-time employee)
-strategic leadership team struggles to paradigm shift, which results in biased financial investment decisions around the org and certain departments being neglected.
-“it will get better eventually” mentality about everything.

pros: Friendly, understanding, cooperative, fair, honest. I always enjoyed working with the different departments. They were understanding of classes and sickness. If someone messed up they were fair about helping them learn the appropriate way to do something.
cons: Not much for cons from my perspective.

review_title: Great community, lots of fun, but low pay.
pros: I loved the friendly atmosphere the entire university had. Definitely the place you want to be for family-like co-workers.
cons: The pay was pretty rough- especially, it seemed, for female staff/faculty.

pros: You will feel the present of God, Jesus Christ, and Holy Spirit.  The Student worship services are on FIRE.

pros: Amazing working environment. Wonderful co-workers. Very fulfilling job.

review_title: Poor Organizational Structure & Human Resources practices.
pros: North Central University only positive is that it is considered a learning institution.
cons: Poor leadership, poor organizational structure, constant battles and internal strife, misleading employees and potential employees with suggestion that enrollment is not a sales environment. It totally is a sales environment with sales quotas.
